list_definition.definition: to think probable; to believe or guess

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Who do you suppose telephoned today?
‘I suppose you’ll be going to the meeting?’ ‘Yes, I suppose so / No, I don’t suppose so.’
‘Surely her statement can’t be correct?’ ‘No, I suppose not’.

list_definition.definition: to accept as true for the sake of argument; to consider as a possibility

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: (Let’s) suppose we each had $100 to spend
Suppose the train’s late – what shall we do?

list_definition.mean_english: coi như một lời đề nghị
list_definition.definition: used to make a suggestion or give an order in a polite way

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Suppose you make us a cup of tea!

list_ex_of_english: Ideally, the medium is supposed to be precisely what the word indicates: a neutral, transparent conduit between the two worlds.
The back of the menu, like the club name, inverted another old female stereotype, this time women's supposed cattiness among themselves.
One supposes that the formation of the adult array of b-cells is not so different from that of a-cells.
She is supposed to represent herself (and write representations of) normal ways of behaving and thinking.
The challenge has come from what was supposed to be the heart of the mechanistic world view - from physics.
Even though this approach has focused on negotiation, the framework is supposed to be generic enough to accept different types of dialogue.
Agent interactions: how agents of different meta-models are supposed to interact using communications or the environment.
The body of every future organism was supposed to have been created in that first moment of time.
